website_summaries.verdict: This device crushes ice and mixes drink ingredients together while already in your glass.
pros: Blends drinks and crushes ice while already in the glass
cons: Difficult to use if you're only working with a small amount of liquid or ice

customer_reviews.title: [UPDATED] Died on very first use...
customer_reviews.text: Note: this is an updated review, previously one star. I received a defective blender that gave out while making a lemon aioli, which was ridiculous. The company, however, reached out to me via email and was more than willing to replace the product. I think it certainly says a lot about a company's business mode when they are willing to reach out to dissatisfied consumers (I didn't reach out to them; they emailed me first). Long story short, I got my blender today and it works. The broken blender threw a huge wrench into an important VIP dinner, but mistakes happen, and I won't hold this boo boo against the company.
customer_reviews.author: Khang Truong

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is the best immersion blender ever. It has replaced my blender and food processor. I have had one for 6 months and the blade never gets dull. I make salsa, smoothies, mayonnaise, sorbet, soup, sauces, etc. I also chop garlic and onions with it. It is very easy to clean also. One of my kitchen essentials.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first day of use, after second try
customer_reviews.text: We received the item two days ago and used it for the first time today. The white plastic circle piece from the inside of the holder/handle came off, and now the removable part won’t lock into place anymore, rendering the blender unfit for use. I sent the seller a message about the issue. Will update if I hear back from seller.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMomandDad

customer_reviews.title: might not be for soapers
customer_reviews.text: burned out on first use making a batch of CP Soap. They reached out to me to send a replacement.. they get big points for that. I will see how the replacement stands up and will update this review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Geneva C

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than plastic versions for soap making
customer_reviews.text: I started with a less expensive version that has a plastic arm with steel blades. It worked alright for mixing soups but not so much for soap making. I blend my own body and hand wash using aloe, honey, glycerin and castile soap. Plastic one burnt out after 3 months of average use. About once a week mixing soaps. This baby has a steel arm and blades. It's much heavier that the plastic one but in a good way. It's just as easy to hold but feels sturdier. It has absolutely no problem mixing thicker fluids such as honey and aloe Vera gel. This is truly the multi tasker stick blender.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quick way to blend soft items and can crush ice but best to used crushed ice.
customer_reviews.text: Page 5 of the Chefman Hand Blender manual under Helpful HINTS #9 For Recipes calling for ice, use crushed ice (not whole cubes) for best results. For the price it is a great for immersion and can crush whole cubes but not ideal. This was my first immersion blender and it took some experimenting to get comfortable with using. For sure read all of the helpful hints on page 5 of the user manual.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to make my smoothies every morning. I was using a bullet type of blender and it was so noisy and I had to have it on for bit of time. It always woke up my husband. I found this and I could not believe how quiet and powerful it was! He doesn't hear it at all in the morning anymore - and I only have to use it for 30 seconds or so! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean and does it all!
customer_reviews.text: This hand blender is EASY to use and EASY to clean. It will blend anything - including ice. I am using it daily. Very helpful purchase at a great price! Unlike some other hand blenders, you only need push one easy button to make it go! go! go!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Messner

customer_reviews.title: Award winning customer service
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this item is the color and the fact that it's detachable. I was very disappointed at the strength of the motor. I guess you get what you pay for. Edit: The replacement is wonderful!!! I appreciate the five sta rcustomer service Chefman gave to rectify the issue and make me happy. Thank you. I'm very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little blender!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome blender for a great price and the color options make it even better! I just got this a few days ago, and have used it everyday since. I love the ease of use and portability. Certainly beats out the old hand blender. I’ve used this to make soup and daily to make eggs. It’s a little bigger than I thought and the blades take a little more effort to clean, but this is definitely a worthwhile purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after second use.
customer_reviews.text: I used it twice. It stopped working after the second use. It will not turn on. It was properly used. My previous stick blender lasted me 4 years. I only replaced it because the plastic on the button had worn away. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: K&NH

customer_reviews.title: What a great little blender!
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting an immersion blender for some time but didn't want to spend a great deal of money. This one works beautifully. I have even used it on mashed potatoes which doesn't make them perfect but certainly pretty darn good for everyday. I use it all the time on soups and even to whip up my coffee and cream for a treat. Iced coffees tastes better than what I would pay extra for if a barista made them! Super easy to clean. This was a perfect choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: mommermom

customer_reviews.title: Great for pureeing soups
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried this, I was disappointed. I think in retrospect I needed to have more liquid(I tried to make a fruit smoothie with lots of banana(unfrozen)). But the real purpose I bought this for was to puree soups, and there it worked beautifully! So overall, I'm pleased. I think I might see about purchasing a metal cup to mix smoothies in, as it's a bit too difficult in a bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because I liked that it was all metal and wouldn't melt out ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I liked that it was all metal and wouldn't melt out of shape like my last plastic one did. It does seem really nice and sturdy, I use it for hot liquids, I can a lot of tomato soup, applebutter, etc., it works, but is not as powerful as my last immersion blender. It does the job, but takes more moving around on my part and takes longer to do it. The suction power isn't what I expected, still a good trade because it won't melt, lol, and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: sconelady

customer_reviews.title: A little miracle
customer_reviews.text: I use my blender mainly to make smooth creamed soup (without the cream LOL) with any vegetables that I boil in bouillon. It takes no time and I NEVER waist any vegetables anymore! This is my 2nd one that I bought for my son who grows just about every vegetables. I may buy even more as present during the Holidays. I just love this little appliance, it is my favorite for sure!
customer_reviews.author: daisiedude

customer_reviews.title: Great unity.
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great, I love it. So easy to use and clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Sapp

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: Oh man do not buy this! It wont even blend fresh fruit. It has an awful smell of the motor burning and leaves that terrible metallic smokey burnt plastic taste! Oh goodness its so bad! I cant return because I waited to long to use it. Thats my fault. But please dont buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I make my own lotions and soaps, and there’s always so much waste in a regular blender. I made my first batch of lotion with Chefman, and it came out perfect. I then simply unlatched the blending tool from the base, put it in the dishwasher, and then used it to blend in my pot of vegetable soup. It was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Casey

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I still use this, but I should have trusted this one reviewer. I cut my finger badly with this. The issue is the button. If you accidentally touch the on button, the blade starts to move. I wish it was a switch of some sort so that it's harder to accidentally press the button. Also, you have to keep pushing the button and the handle is fat and a bit heavy, so it makes you tired holing with your finger keep holding the on button.
customer_reviews.author: Aiko

customer_reviews.title: Great immersion blender!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about a month, twice/three times per week. So far so good! It has a nice color and it is pretty silent. I think it is a great product for people like me that need a good immersion blender, without spending lots of money. Definitely recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Morgante

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this blender everyday since I received it a few weeks ago. It works very well. The motor feels really warm after using it, but it doesn't seem to interfer with function or holding it. Easy to remove the shaft, will look for additional attachments if any are manufactured. The motor housing is easy to hold in one hand and the buttons depress easily. The two speeds work well and it is easy to clean. I am giving 4 stars because sometimes the food gets stuck in the little openings around the edges of the dome around the blade. Overall very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dashaina

customer_reviews.title: Spinning blade comes off
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use, once every 2 weeks at max, the spinning blade comes down in the soup
customer_reviews.author: VH

customer_reviews.title: love it, great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this...I now own 3 in different colors and have given a couple as gifts. Over the years as a soapmaker I've owned many brands. This one isn't as powerful as some, but it does the job well. Additionally, I use one imy kitchen for smoothies, saices and bulletproof coffee. I especially love the fact it doesn't have the safety button on top which others have and I can't use Bec it requires two hands.
customer_reviews.author: Antoniette k.

customer_reviews.title: Not too powerfull
customer_reviews.text: Its just o.k. Not very powerful, as other had mentioned. I used it to make broccoli soup, and the broccoli was hot, yet it struggled to grind up the broccoli. My old immersion blender was great, but it finally broke, so I thought I'd try this one.If your someone who makes a lot of soup in the winter, you may want to pass this one & go for something better. I'm only keeping it because I also make soap, and really should have an extra immersion blender, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: SooZeeQ

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, horrible dangerous blender!
customer_reviews.text: Update #2 do not buy!!! Bought 2 first one died on its 2and use, and the one I reordered after that didn't last 1hour. JUNK! JUNK! UPDATE. MOTOR IS SHOT. STOPPED WORKING COMPLETELY. This is only the 3rd time using it. Complete junk.......... I liked the design and there trigger button design. But after 2 or 3 uses these blender was extremely hot to touch when plugged in. Even when not in use, say idle plugged in for 10-15 minutes and when I came back to use it it was still extremely hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed. Died on the spot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to make soup. The first time I used this hand blender I attempted to blend soft, cooked vegetables and the motor started smoking and died. I thought it might start again after giving it some time to cool off, but no. It worked for all of 30 seconds and died. How disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: AndreaNicole

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 9 months (but seller replaced it)
customer_reviews.text: (Note: The seller contacted me to replace the blender after seeing my review. I was not asking for, nor expecting, this, so I rank them as an honorable company.) I bought this to replace a different hand blender that had lasted for years. It worked okay, but stopped much more easily than my old one, even for soft fruit. Worse, it went kaput after only 9 months, and I never blended anything difficult. No ice or anything, just fruit & liquid. The motor still works, but the attachment for the stem of the blade broke so it can't spin anymore. I'll be replacing it with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: evf

customer_reviews.title: I love my new blender
customer_reviews.text: I love my new blender. It is great for making smoothies. It does not have any trouble throughly blending frozen fruit. It also blends firm tofu for syo-nays so it is very smooth. The best part is the cleaning. I just rense it under running water. In about 2 minutes I have made a smoothie and have everything cleaned and put away. I love this blender. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Chefman Immersion Stick Hand Blender is a great puree tool, has 2 speeds, Easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second power stick we've had and our first one wasn't anywhere close to the quality and performance level as our new Chefman Immersion Stick Blender. It is lightweight and easy to hold. We are very pleased with the short time it takes to puree. It is, pleasantly, very much quieter than our former one. We've had our Chefman Stick Blender for a week and we've used it several times per day, every day. Clean up is easy and uneventful. Chefman, you rock!!! Thanks for a great product. BTW: We LOVED the color selections!!
customer_reviews.author: Sew and Sew Sue

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: I'm an very disappointed! I loved how it feels and looks but when I used it it had very little power, it got hot after 5 minutes of use and then stopped working..... now I need to return it and get a new one.... As I use this for work, this is a huge inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: TMSC

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I am a soapcrafter, and purchased this immersion blender form that purpose. I initially liked the blender very much, as it was lightweight and worked very well. HOWEVER, as I started a batch of soap today, the blender literally fell apart in my hands. The sharp blade came loose and fell into my soap batter. I’m extremely disappointed, and will not purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stick Blender
customer_reviews.text: I love this immersion stick blender! The ergonomic handle makes holding the blender a pleasure. It fits comfortably in my hand. It has good power as well. I use this stick blender for making cold processed soap. It does a great job of blending the oils during the saponification process. I believe it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: LauraM

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is really really good quality for the price. The color and texture of the handle is wonderful. All of the parts seem very sturdy and built to last. The blend blade shaft is removable for cleaning. Blends quickly and well.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle N

customer_reviews.title: Already faulty after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this. We’ve used several immersion blenders and this was a total waste for us. It doesn’t have much power, and now after having had it 4 months, the motor is now stuck on, even when you unplug and plug it back in, we cannot get it to shut off. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: ecochic

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this thing! So much easier to make soups and whatnot. It has two speeds so you can decide how blended you want things. It is super easy to clean. Just twist off the bottom and run it under some hot water. Everything just rinses off. I only use soap for killing any germs as you don't have to scrub it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Chefman immediately sent me a new blender next day delivery and it works great! No problems
customer_reviews.text: First one broke after 3 uses. Chefman immediately sent me a new blender next day delivery and it works great! No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Williams

customer_reviews.title: I love this stick blender!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Chefman immersion blender! I bought this one to replace one (different brand) that didn't last nearly as long as any I'd owned previously. I even love the gorgeous box that they come in! I am a soapmaker and use immersion blenders as part of the soapmaking process. A powerful tool is so necessary when mixing the oils and lye together. I teach soapmaking classes as well and plan to recommend Chefman stick blenders to my students. I do plan to purchase a few more over the next few months to replace my other brand blenders, too! The only "issue" I've had is that I have yet to personally locate one in my favorite color!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Love the quality and colors!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my new chefman immersion blender! Customer Service is amazing with Chefman and I even got it a day earlier :) I love the colors and how heavy duty it is :) it's so quiet that I can make guac dips real quick while my son takes his nap. I also used it to make cake, it's probably better for cake batter than brownie batter though since it doesn't have the whisks! :) overall im happy with mine.
customer_reviews.author: mayraalexandra

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I bought it for making cold process ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I bought it for making cold process soap. But it worked so well my husband wanted one for the kitchen so I bought another!!
customer_reviews.author: LaruePol

customer_reviews.title: It won't last long plus there are better designs out there
customer_reviews.text: It died after just over a year, just outside of warranty. The design isn't so great, the open holes on the metal part that houses the blades is not a good design. It's meant to be there for flow, but in reality it just get gummed up. Better designs I've seen without this issue have a wavy edge to the housing for the blade instead of holes for flow.
customer_reviews.author: Tyranasaurus tam

customer_reviews.title: Product is not repairable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to replace one that I have had for about one year. I found that the cutter assembly driveshaft dropped out of the bottom of the tool. It appeared that some internal washers and a spring clip had rusted to the point of failure, due to there being no bottom shaft seal to keep fluids from entering the cutter tube . Since the driveshaft is not removable, the tool is not repairable and needed to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Economist

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I used this hand held immersion blender less than 20 times before it literally fell apart in my hands. Don't waste your money. It is junk. Spend a little more money and get something that is well made and will last a few years at least. Before it fell apart and broke- literally screws falling out in my soup it almost never locked into place leaving me to fish out the blender part from the bottom of the pot. I would not recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Makes fruit smoothies and goes right thru frozen fruit easily.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. I am pretty sure it used to come with a plastic cup to mix things in? I use it regularly to make smoothies and it does an excellent job of quickly puréeing frozen strawberries and ice cubes. After two years the blades were just as sharp as ever. I only needed a replacement because I lost mine when moving. I have used other ones and they just don’t go thruogh frozen fruit like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: abby binder

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have used several of these blenders and this Chefman is by far, the best of the lot.
customer_reviews.author: PAM

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really like it but the handle gets super hot to hold after just a few seconds of use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Feroe

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good for smoothing soups and fruit smoothies. Don’t try to use it on ice chunks or to purée fibrous vegetables like corn kernels because it will clog up and not effeciently blend. My arm got pretty tired from blending corn for corn chowder. It took over 10 minutes and I had to add a lot of milk to thin it out for the blender to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a month
customer_reviews.text: I'm really upset that I spent money on this. It broke after 3 uses. Didn't even last a month. I was using it on cooked cauliflower to make mashed cauliflower so it was working hard, but it says it has a lot of power and should have been fine. It was amazing after the first 2 times, but that third time it was slow from the beginning and then died halfway through. Thank God I had a regular blender to finish the job. I bought this because I didn't want to have to clean that one everytime, but after wasting this money, I will have to go back to that until I find a better hand blender.
customer_reviews.author: Chengu

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working during first use. Used for less then a minute to mix a liquid fluid batter. Shaft is lightweight yet flimsy feeling. Was hoping it would be a good replacement for my vremi stick blender, which I used for 4 years everyday before the shaft gave out. Vremi Motor is still strong. Incredibly sad vremi no longer sells the handheld stick blender and that I bought this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is great! So easy to clean (blend some warm soapy ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is great! So easy to clean (blend some warm soapy water), so easy to use. Haven't had anything break on it. Nice matte finish, good hand texture. Good design for blade and cage, does a great job in mixing up and aerating the material, especially when moving the blender up and down. I've really been enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Works well for smoothie and purée.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my Immersion stick about a month and I like it so far. It has a little wobble on high but it doesn’t effect the way it works. I have used it to purée several meats and vegetables and to grind about a half cup of coffee beans. I would not recommend using it regularly for grinding coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Benelu

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It was a little awkward at first because I had never used anything like it. I thought it would be heavy and cumbersome, but after a couple of tries it got easier. I think it has a good amount of power, which worked well for my soups. I look forward to experimenting more with it.
customer_reviews.author: AngieT.

customer_reviews.title: The power level was perfect, high enough to get the job done
customer_reviews.text: This device works exactly as expected. The power level was perfect, high enough to get the job done, but not so much that I had sauce all of the kitchen. I am not sure how I lived without this devices.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Works well but feels flimsy and lasted just passed 1-year warranty
customer_reviews.text: When I unpacked this blender last year, I noticed that it felt a lot less solid than the Cuisine Art blender I was replacing. The blade assembly also felt flimsier. It did a good enough job blending but struggled somewhat with harder food items. After 13 months of frequent use, the blade assembly fell out and can't be reattached. I will go with a more expensive and hopefully sturdier blender as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! Definitely stronger then my old stick blender, I just use this for smoothies and it gets the job done! My only complaint is the actual blender part is wider then my old stick blender so I had to get different containers with a wider opening for this one (which is more my error for not thinking about that before ordering). But I would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent at smoothies with ice
customer_reviews.text: I waited until we had this for a few weeks to provide a review. This stick blender is fantastic. The detachable stick with the blades is easy to clean and holds up to the top rack in the dishwasher well. The best part is that is handles ice in smoothies with no problem. We make smoothies almost every day and this is great. Several more expensive stick blenders specifically say that they will not crush ice. I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Adams

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat clunky but good overall
customer_reviews.text: The mixer is longer than the standard immersion blender, so I have to stand up on my toes to use it on the countertop. It is not the easiest to wash as the blade is sharp and you can get cut while trying to wash it if you aren’t careful. The two speeds seem redundant as they are very similar. I do love the texture of the handle. The color is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer chick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this immersion blender and I did, initially. I used it primarily for making smoothies and it worked well. Initially I bought it in 2017, then the end of last year the blade somehow came loose and kept slipping out, so the blender wasn't working. I bought a new one at the end of December 2018, and then the same thing has happened again and the new blade came loose. It's been less than two months so I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came through in an emergency
customer_reviews.text: I was using my standard blender to make a pie filling, but the heavy mixture must have overwhelmed it because the bottom came off the container! Fortunately I had my pink Chefman and was able to salvage my pie. Blending power is adequate, it's easy to operate, and the detachable blade assembly was the easiest part of this misadventure to clean up. Definitely worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Selinko

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: What I call the "smoothie attachment" of my Cuisinart stick blender failed, so I opted to buy this much-cheaper replacement and keep the Cuisinart and its other attachments for whisking and dicing. To my delight, I found this unit easy to hold, equally easy to clean, and even a tad FASTER than the Cuisinart. Buy without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: R. Gregory Capaldini

customer_reviews.title: ... spent some time reading reviews on which was the best stick blender
customer_reviews.text: I spent some time reading reviews on which was the best stick blender. This one did not have all 5 stars but for the price I decided to give it a go. Wasn't disappointed. It is so powerful and easy to manage. I make my homemade pesto and mayo with it. The mayo literally takes like 30-60 secs and the pesto a little longer but thats cause it has more ingredients and tougher ingredients to blend. But it gets it and the pesto always comes out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: olivia

customer_reviews.title: Every kitchen needs one of these!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my immersion blender several months ago now so I have had plenty of time to use it before reviewing. I love it! I use it when trying to reduce the chunks in my salsa (so that the kids will eat it), I've used it in many different soups, for all different kinds of baking mixes, pancake batter, you name it! I don't love it for making smoothies, but for everything else it gets an A+ in my book! Ordering one for my mom today, every kitchen needs one of these.
customer_reviews.author: katerylansmommy

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Use for Soapmaking!
customer_reviews.text: We had high hopes that this would work for soapmaking after reading great reviews. Either we received a faulty one, or the product just isn’t great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Becky A.

customer_reviews.title: blade shaft broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product (hot pink) and it lasted for three years. I purchased again in 2020 (black) and I used it once and it broke. The blade would not spin and did not seat properly in the shaft. Liquids entered the blade shaft and black pieces flaked out. The hot pink version was made in 2016 and the black version was made in 2014. The hot pink had a silicon gasket around the base of the blade shaft, but the black one did not. Sadly, amazon return window is closed, so I will contact chefman directly and hope they will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: B S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much useless
customer_reviews.text: The immersion blender No longer works (after occasional use within first 3 months). The blades no longer spins. The motor does makes some noise - assuming that it still works. However when I connect blade to the motor no action. Pretty much useless. Can u please suggest remedy or send an alternate working piece. I landed up buying this model based on good reviews, but I am really thinking on my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blender knowing that it was a cheap product, thought I would give it a try anyway. It worked great the 4 times I used it. Then it died. I was only blending hot pepper sauce and soups, nothing too thick. After it died gave it to the husband (an electrical technician) to take a part, hoping maybe just a thermal fuse that could be changed out. But it was not. The motor itself is very poorly made. Very cheap pressed together connections. There is a reason it is only $25.00. You definitely get what you pay for. Absolutely a piece of garbage. Dont buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan'smama

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 15 Months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on March 8th, 2019, today the motor stopped working. It has a year warranty. Today is June 11th. I like that it has one-button operation as opposed to Cuisinart that you have to press two buttons to get theirs to blend. I feel it should last longer than 15 months. Will not purçhase Chefman again.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C

customer_reviews.title: Could have faulty button that will stop working.  May be a once in a while situation.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Chefman Hand Blender in October 2017, after my Cuisinart hand blender fell apart. I thought it might be better, with two speeds, 300 Watts, and nicely made. It was - for a while. Around the first of February, the button for high speed blending and ice stopped working for no apparent reason. I've written the manufacturer and haven't yet heard back, since I wrote a day or two ago. I liked it otherwise! These hand blenders do many things that no other kitchen equipment does, and I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Lance B. White

customer_reviews.title: Love but worried now...
customer_reviews.text: I’m using the heck out of this product, as I’m currently pregnant and eating ice is about all I can keep down, along with an occasional protein shake. Noticed black stuff in the detachable part and started washing it... then tons of black water was rinsing from the stick portion. Now, I’m concerned because there’s no way to open and clean it or let it dry and it’s clearly not water tight... so is this black fluid getting into what I make from the blade side? I have no way of knowing...
customer_reviews.author: Christen

customer_reviews.title: extra long shaft
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a large stock pot; making soups and sauces for canning. I needed one with a long shaft and power. This stick blender has both! It is also very easy to clean. I have used it several times now and it has made a world of difference. would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 months before it broke
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 6 months of use. Got it “used like new” which I assumed meant used and returned within the 30 day limit. I figured it would last a couple of years at least, seeing as we only use it for scrambling large batch eggs and other liquids. The motor heat melted down a plastic washer that holds the stick inside the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Britt

customer_reviews.title: No-go for frothing a drink up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to froth my morning beverage. And it failed to perform as I needed it to. I was using my nutribullet, but wanted to get away from blending hot liquid in plastic (plastic got tiny cracks from it). Bought this tool and tried various ways to get a good foam and no-go. Wish it did work the way I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.author: fearless mum

customer_reviews.title: Really love it! Good choice.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got this one instead of the other top brand. It has way more power, and very quiet too. I use it for my morning protein shake's with frozen fruit. Does a fantastic job. 5 star's for sure. I'd give it 10 if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Basel

customer_reviews.title: This versatile mixer was a great purchase. It is easy to use and clean ...
customer_reviews.text: This versatile mixer was a great purchase. It is easy to use and clean and makes baking holiday treats much easier!! It is very easy to mix up cakes, batter, etc instead to lugging our out huge kitchen aid mixer! This is perfect for holiday cooking!
customer_reviews.author: Jodie K.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing immersion blender. I bought it to replace one that finally died on me. I used it to puree a lot of soups. This new blender can barely do the job. It is unable to properly puree celery -- it leaves celery strings in the soup. Also, it can't deal with parsley. And these vegetables are very soft, they've simmered for hours. I guess I need a blender with more power, this one is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenLady

customer_reviews.title: Attachment blade constantly breaks!
customer_reviews.text: The attachment blade constantly breaks. They’ll replace it, but they send you a whole new unit instead of just the blade, so now I’m stuck with a bunch of motor units and only one blade. The environmentalist in me doesn’t feel like that’s very sustainable.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD S POWELL

customer_reviews.title: Buying backups!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. The color is so cute, it works great for many projects and has lasted me several months now. The ONLY complaint I have is that it is difficult to clean, but if you use bleach water, turn it on high and then do the same with cleaning alcohol, it will last a lot longer and be good as new! Buying several more to have on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey Belle

customer_reviews.title: Will buy brand name next time -- died in 9 months
customer_reviews.text: The blender was fine while it worked - but it died completely within 9 months and started having issues about 6 months in with light use (2 to 3 smoothies per week). My previous Cuisineart model lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Blender Burnout
customer_reviews.text: This product burned out after about 6 uses 5-10 minutes in length each - used for making soap (just blending oil together). super disappointed about this and I unfortunately will not buy it again. I hope it doesn't burn out for anyone else because we were in a time crunch and had to go out and buy a new one for $60. I guess I would have just spent more money on it in the first place - seems like this one wasn't very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: great for making soup!
customer_reviews.text: love this so much! I like to use cream cheese in a lot of my soups but getting them to be creamy and not chunky can be challenging but no problem with this hand blender. Its really powerful, easy to use attractive looking. The only thing is doesn't work that great for large frozen strawberries in a smoothie or large pieces of ice cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua and Michele

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing Immersion Stick, awesome color choices!  It blows the others out of the water.  You WON'T be disappointed!!♡
customer_reviews.text: The color is beautiful. I looked at some reviews for the best one, I think it rated 3rd or 4th, but the others had a lot of other things with them, were more expensive and didn't come in all the amazing colors. This is the best Immersion stick handmixer. I have tried a couple, but this one is the best I have used. The price was very reasonable for such a quality item. If you are looking to purchase one, I would 100% recommend this one. Plus you can put a little color in you kitchen because there is a lot of colors to choose from. You will be very happy you got it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Althaus

customer_reviews.title: You think she wants this but she wants a bathrobe.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously. Get her a bathrobe. She already has tons of stuff in the kitchen she doesn't use. You know she would've bought one of these at target on an impulse already if she really wanted one. You only think its useful because you think cooking is taking what she made out of the fridge and putting it in the toaster oven. Get her a bathrobe.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Schell

customer_reviews.title: great immersion blender
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my current immersion blender (one of my kids broke the attachment and I was unable to purchase a replacement part). We use this mostly to blend smoothies, and I really liked the cute color options. We've had this for a few weeks, and it works as promised.
customer_reviews.author: amymcg

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: Using this to blend pear sauce... hoisting/ cleaning a heavy glass blender pitcher is difficult for me, so this is great! Rinse immediately and it's good. Love the slow/ fast buttons, easy to figure out how to maneuver without splattering. Glad I purchased a corded version, no dead batteries when I'm ready to blend/ puree something. This has been a very useful purchase!
customer_reviews.author: midwest gal

customer_reviews.title: Loved it while it lasted but broke twice on me
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this stick blender and used it on a daily basis, but a few months after I bought it the stick that the blade is attached to came loose. When you try to re-screw it in, it works for a few seconds but then the blade pops out again. So I returned it and Amazon sent me another one just like it. It worked for several months but just yesterday, the same exact thing happened (all I was doing was whipping milk, nothing hard). I am so disappointed and will have to order a different brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Elliff

customer_reviews.title: One use and died
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this blender, but I used it once and it died. I was making soap and it got really warm, then stopped working in the middle of mixing. I plugged it in the following day thinking it needed to cool down, but it did not work. Very disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Kelly I.

customer_reviews.title: This blender is the best!
customer_reviews.text: This chefman blender is easy to hold, for a person with small hands you don't want a blender as powerful as this one to slip out of your grip. the handle is soft to the touch and easy to grip. It blends very well right out of the box! Washed the bottom attachment. Loved the color ! It matched my kitchen! and a few other accessories. It makes smoothies very easily too. It doesn't take long to whip up a smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: D.A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this blender. I own a high-end hand blender and this is just as good! Nice and easy to hold. Power is just perfect and it's not loud at all like other hand blenders. Love the color variety and it's so easy to clean just unlock the blender part and throw into the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Samersaadi

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and easy to clean. I like how well it mixes things. Many kitchen tools serve a single purpose, but when they're needed, they make the task at hand easier. This is one such tool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: At this price you can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has all the power and clean up is a breeze. With a twist the shaft comes off and viola!! Batters and eggs are so fluffy it doesn’t make sense. I have had three emulsifiers over twenty years and this is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Paddlewave

customer_reviews.title: It has a CORD
customer_reviews.text: I'm so scatterbrained sometimes. I didn't realize when I bought this that it's not cordless. The cord really gets in the way. Other than that little fact, this works great. I bought it in the copper color, and it has a really nice finish. Blended up a pot of broccoli cheese soup in short order!
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Got really hot while using...
customer_reviews.text: The motor got extremely hot after using for 5 minutes. I had to rest it for 20 minutes or so before I could continue making my homemade lotion. It did the job though...I'm just concerned that the motor may blow soon and it's my first time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Carla C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for "Make Your Own"
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I appreciate the speed variation. I'm now making my own mayonnaise on a regular basis using the immersion blender. No sugar, high-quality oils and better than anything I've ever bought off-the-shelf. Also using it to blend soups into a finer, more family-friendly texture. Why didn't I have one of these gadgets years ago?
customer_reviews.author: Cat in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: nice looking but - - -
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking unit, but for my purposes - making fruit smoothies - it seems to be lacking in power, the cheap model from Wall Mart does a better job. Go figure!? I keep it as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Immersion blender
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make potato leek soup. Easy, fit nicely in my hand and clean up was easy. Can't wait for my next culinary creation so I can use this immersion blender again.
customer_reviews.author: caroline

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product.
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. We bought this as our next mixer (to make soap) when the current one burned out. Four months later we pulled it out and it lasted one day/two uses and it burned out. What a rip-off. I wanted to give it zero stars but the review would not submit..
customer_reviews.author: Doug Broeker

customer_reviews.title: It is a great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: It is a great tool for the money. My daughter uses it a few times everyday to crush her ice drinks and it is holding up well. I cant give it 5 stars because I ordered a pretty turquoise one and they sent me a lame rose color...disappointed about that.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Etchen

customer_reviews.title: One star: not good for daily smoothies
customer_reviews.text: Update #2: replacement broke after about 3 months of daily use. Conclusion: this blender ISN’T good for daily blending of ice/smoothies. We have gone back to using our standard countertop blender.... less convenient, but dependable. Update: Company contacted us and sent a replacement. Fingers crossed this one works longer! Worked great for a few months, but the blade has started to fall out after 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Marek and Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than the motor burned up on the first use. It didn’t seem to be blending very well and the it just stopped and the casing was hot to the touch. My suggestion to everyone is to stay away from this piece of garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife. She had something similar to this many years ago. She has used this twice since we got it and she can't stop telling me how much she loves this. I am sure we have not diacovered all it's features yet, but if we were to stop our learning today it was WELL WORTH THE MONEY. We couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Almost important to have as a Kitchen Aid mixer
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these from the first days they appeared on the market but it recently died. This new model is much nicer. Make a lot of soups and this is a must have appliance.
customer_reviews.author: JUDITH MCCORKLE

product_meta.title: Chefman Immersion Stick Hand Blender with Stainless Steel Shaft & Blades, Powerful Ice Crushing 2-Speed Control Handheld Mixer, Purees Smoothie, Sauces & Soups, 300 Watts, Turquoise
product_meta.description:
Color:Turquoise

Handle all your blending needs with ease using the Chefman Immersion Blender. Equipped with a powerful 300-Watt ultra-quiet motor, this immersion hand blender quickly purees soups, blends batters, smoothies, sauces, liquefies fruit and leafy greens, mixes baby formulas, and more, so you can make delicious creations in seconds.

Make your dishes as smooth as our silk-touch feel; the mixers unique blade provides extremely smooth and even blending, while its protective blade guard helps prevent splattering. With a sleek stick design, it easily reaches into mixing bowls, large cooking pots, and pitchers so you can blend an array of items conveniently and hassle-free. The lightweight design, easy-to-grip ergonomic handle, and simple push-button control make this the ultimate tool for a variety of blending needs. Shaft detaches with just a twist, and detachable parts are dishwasher safe, making this stick blender as easy to clean as it is to use. Immerse yourself in the possibilities!

Make the most of your purchase with access to Club Chefman for tailor-made recipes, tutorial videos, and more! cETL approved with advanced safety technology for long-lasting durability, 30 Day No-Questions-Asked Money-Back Guarantee, & 1-year hassle-free warranty provided by Chefman
feature_bullets: BETTER BLENDING: Ergonomic soft silk-touch rubberized handle with simple push button dual speed control is the prefect one hand mixer for a variety of kitchen blending task from blending dips to mixing cake batter, crush frozen fruit for smoothies and more!

HIGH POWER: The Chefman immersion blender has a high powered 300 Watt motor to handle more blending tasks quietly & with ease and is compatible with 120 Volts. This food blender will liquefy fruit or leafy greens, mix baby formulas, and blend ingredients together seamlessly.

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL: Specially designed cross blades make perfect pureed dishes such as smoothies, sauces, soups, and dips. The ultimate tool for a variety of blending options, this stick blender can reach into mixing bowls, large cooking pots, and pitchers.

DISHWASHER SAFE: Blade detaches with just a twist, making cleanup as easy as 1-2-3, and detachable parts are top rack dishwasher safe, making this stick blender as easy to clean as it is to use. Make sure not to immerse the cord in water.

RESOURCES: cETL approved with advanced safety technology for long lasting durability, & 1-year provided by Chefman, so you can purchase worry-free - we've got your back! For information on how to use your product, scroll down for a PDF User Guide. 300 Watts/120 Volts

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,562 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
